stages.logText: In a clearing, you met Tjure, who desperately asked for your help. He had once found a mermaid asleep on the beach at the river. The colorful tail attracted him so much that he pulled out a dazzling scale and ran away.

Crying and mourning, the mermaid called after him. Finally she cursed him. Since then, Tjure has never been happy. He just wanted to get rid of the scale. Nevertheless, he never ventured back to the vicinity of the river.

A wise woman told Tjure that he could neither throw away nor destroy the scale. His only salvation would be to give it back or to have someone buy it from him. But who would ever want to incur the wrath of a mermaid?
You decided not to help Tjure.
As soon as you held the scale in your hands, a great sluggishness and dispair came over you.
You put the scale on the mark on the ground.
There rang out a beautiful song of gratitude.
You found a heavy bag of gold.
Told by Umar to say he sent you at the inn.
